text: [Music]
there are four topics that we cover in
marketing Innovation the first is
marketing toolkit where we give the
participants 10 tools that we use and in
the courses that we teach here and also
with real entrepreneurs that allow them
to create um new products and services
and enter new Target markets the second
is a a uh session that Don under nitzky
leads and it's called creating markets
while creating products it takes two to
tango and it's a really beautiful set of
examples of why and how you need to
simultaneously cultivate customers and
markets while you're developing the
product and then have a a feedback loop
back and forth um there she's not the
only person who's thinking this is
important we all do and certainly Steve
blank has said something very similar in
uh four steps to the Epiphany with
customer development and we have great
fness for Steve but uh so this this
second piece is very key the third piece
is um a case study that I do about Tesla
Motors to
help uh people think about how do we
really really understand the needs of
different segments for different
products and then how do we build what
we call a whole product that will really
meet the needs of those customers and
then if we need Partners to help us
build that whole product produ who do we
partner with how and why so it's very
practical and it actually is built on
real things that have happened at Tesla
and quite interesting as well we have
one of our alumni from the course who
now works at Tesla who will offer some
of her perspective at the end of that
session and the fourth and I think most
amazing part of the whole series is a
session led by Linda Smith on marketing
measurement where she allows you to as a
participant you take either your company
or another company you're interested in
and you apply marketing measurement
tools to a real company to see how it's
doing this is an area that has become
increasingly important in the world of
Internet social media where you can do a
lot of analytics it's an area that I
don't know anybody on Earth who knows
more about it than Linda and she puts
this information across and gives you
skills in a way that is very very
intuitive and um we're just thrilled to
have it so those are the four pieces of
the
course
we have a double objective for our
participants if they take this course
and learn what they can learn in it the
first is how to develop and deliver a
new product or service to the
marketplace and second is how do you
manage that product or service across
the technology adoption life cycle and
around the world and we think that you
really need to be able to do both things
it's not just about getting a new
product in it's about managing it so it
becomes
sustainable what I hope that
participants take away from this course
is that it's really really important to
figure out who your target markets are
and your customers and what they need
and get a product in their hands as
quickly as possible and because that's
what it takes to lay the foundation to
be successful what I also hope they take
away is that they can do it and they
should give it a
try I hope that the participants the the
people that watch this uh these sessions
have the opportunity to really
understand what a driving force
marketing is in the Innovation um of a
company uh marketing has a lot of
responsibilities but I think one of the
key areas that marketing can contribute
is actually Innovation and it comes from
marketers really being rooted and
understanding what's the company trying
to accomplish what's going on in the
marketplace and then looking at how
marketing can help Drive

innovation
